text: Elena Ramona Andries (born ) is a Romanian female weightlifter, and two time European Champion competing in the 48 kg category until 2018 and 49 kg starting in 2018 after the International Weightlifting Federation reorganized the categories.PDF listing of 2018 Group A world championship entrants in 49 kg representing Romania at international competitions. ==Career== ===World Championships=== She has competed at three world championships, the first being the 2010 World Weightlifting Championships where she competed as a 16 year old. ===European Championships=== She also competed at the 2017 European Weightlifting Championships,Halterofilul Ilie Ciotoiu a cucerit două medalii de bronz la Europenele din Croația where she won a bronze medal in the snatch and total. The following year she competed at the 2018 European Weightlifting Championships in the 48 kg category which was held in her home country of Romania. She won gold medals in all three lifts2018 European Championships Results Book finishing with a total of 179 kg. In 2019 she competed at the 2019 European Weightlifting Championships, which was the first European Weightlifting Championships after the IWF restructured the weight classes. In the 49 kg category she again swept all three gold medals in the snatch, clean & jerk and total.2019 European Championships Results Book Women Her total of 190 kg was a full 29 kg ahead of the silver medalist. ===Doping Ban=== In 2013 she tested positive for Stanazolol at the 2013 European Weightlifting Championships and had her performance and medals disqualified. She was banned from competing from April 8 2013 to April 8 2015. ==Major results== {|class = "wikitable" style="text-align:center;" ! rowspan=2 width=40|Year ! rowspan=2 width=250|Venue ! rowspan=2 width=60|Weight !colspan=4| Snatch (kg) !colspan=4| Clean & Jerk (kg) !rowspan=2 width=40| Total !rowspan=2 width=40| Rank |- !
